intro: Anthyllis subdinarica, commonly known as the Balkan broom. It is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is native to the Balkan Peninsula. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Anthyllis subdinarica is adapted to rocky and dry environments, making it a hardy species found in mountainous regions.
